chemsmart.cli.config module

class chemsmart.cli.config.Config

Bases: object

property chemsmart_dest

Define the destination path for the .chemsmart configuration.

property chemsmart_gaussian

Define the path for the chemsmart gaussian configuration.

property chemsmart_orca

Define the path for the chemsmart orca configuration.

property chemsmart_package_path

Define the path for the chemsmart package.

property chemsmart_server

Define the path for the chemsmart server configuration.

property chemsmart_template

Define the source path for the .chemsmart templates.

property conda_folder

Define the path to the conda folder.

property conda_path

Define the path for the conda environment.

property env_vars

Define the environment variables to be added to the shell config.

setup_environment()

Set up configuration files and environment variables.

property shell_config

Define the shell configuration file path.

chemsmart.cli.config.add_lines_in_yaml_files(target_directory, lines_in_positions, lines_to_add, prepend_string='')

Add lines (lines_to_add) to at specific positions after given lines (lines_in_positions) in all yaml files in a target directory.

chemsmart.cli.config.update_yaml_files(target_directory, value_in_file, user_value)

Update YAML files in ~/.chemsmart/server to replace value_in_file with the provided user_value.

chemsmart.cli.job module

CLI options for ALL jobs that can be run in this package.

chemsmart.cli.logger module

chemsmart.cli.logger.logger_options(f)

chemsmart.cli.main module

CLI interface for chemsmart project.

chemsmart.cli.main.main()

The main function executes on commands: python -m chemsmart and `$ chemsmart `.

This is your program’s entry point.

You can change this function to do whatever you want. .. rubric:: Examples

  • Run a test suite

  • Run a server

  • Do some other stuff

  • Run a command line application (Click, Typer, ArgParse)

  • List all available tasks

  • Run an application (Flask, FastAPI, Django, etc.)

chemsmart.cli.run module

chemsmart.cli.run.process_pipeline(ctx, *args, **kwargs)

Process the job returned by subcommands.

chemsmart.cli.sub module

Submission of jobs to queuing system via cli.
